quoteFirst: "My father, Sir Willoughby Jones, died very suddenly of heart disease
quoteLast: on August 21st. He was not in his room at the moment, but was carried back to his room and restoratives applied, but in vain.
title: Apparitions and thought-transference: an examination of the evidence for telepathy
author: Podmore, Frank, 1856-1910

quoteFirst: After such a day we all went to bed in excellent spirits. Our long depressing wait was very near its end, and we should now escape the terrible prospect of being moved away to the east.
quoteLast: we were wakened up by the commandant, who turned on the electric light and walked along the line of beds, saying, 'Pack up, gentlemen, you have got to start at 3 P.M. and march six miles.' 'Why?' 'I don't know why; those are my orders.
title:
South Africa and the Transvaal War, Vol. 5 (of 8)
From the Disaster at Koorn Spruit to Lord Roberts's Entry into Pretoria
author: Creswicke, Louis

quoteFirst: April when we were suddenly ordered to the station at
quoteLast: It was, I think, April 22. "The Germans have crossed the Yser" was the news that sent a thrill through all of us.
title: Friends of France

quoteFirst: Here the river has worn a narrow channel into the upper edge of a rock-stream, forming a deep pool, in which iris and long aquatic grasses flourish. The light here was much better, and I rapidly reduced my experienced companion’s lead in captures. At
title: In Lakeland Dells and Fells
author: Palmer, William T., 1877-1954

quoteFirst: Late on Wednesday afternoon once more the warning glass fell rapidly, and the breeze that had been fresh and steady suddenly dropped. Towards evening we were almost becalmed, little puffs of hot air only occasionally fanning us as the yacht rose slowly on the heaving sea. But
quoteLast: , the gale came upon us with all its force, preceded by an icy wind that seemed to freeze the ropes into bits of iron.
title: Turkish Harems & Circassian Homes
author: Hope, Andrée, -1898

quoteFirst: _July 23rd._--Very heavy rain during the night. About 2 A.M. the enemy sounded the "turn out," and at 3 the "assembly."
quoteLast: a native pensioner, who left us on the 27th to gain information, came in, and said he had been confined by the enemy thirteen days, but had been to Cawnpore and left it two days ago,--that a British force with twelve guns was there; that they had fought three times with the Nana's troops, and had completely beaten them, taking many guns, and that they were crossing the river preparatory to advancing to our assistance.
title:
The Defence of Lucknow
A Diary Recording the Daily Events during the Siege of the European Residency, from 31st May to 25th September, 1857
author: Wilson, T. F. (Thomas Fourness)

quoteFirst: The next morning I struck out again hunting work, but this time on an empty stomach. About two o'clock in the afternoon I found a hack driver who said he wanted to hire a boy to take care of his horses; he said he would not be going home until
quoteLast: and for me to wait for him in front of the Court house on Fourth street.
title:
A Texas Cow Boy
or, fifteen years on the hurricane deck of a Spanish pony, taken from real life
author: Siringo, Charles A., 1855-1928
